results.title: Our Earth
results.brief_description: A study of the physical properties of the earth in relation to population density and industries. Beginning with oceans and ocean currents and their effects on climate, and consequently on people, the film goes on to show analogous effects of various types of coastline and harbours, lakes, valleys, plateaus, plains and mountains.

results.title: Our daily bread [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Peter Whitchurch, Kinelab and Peter Whitchurch Productions
results.brief_description: Opens with a brief historical survey of the origin of bread. Shows the processes involved in modern bread-making; growing of wheat, harvesting, shipping, storing, milling and baking, and explains the function of yeast in bread-making. The film also surveys the work of the Bread Research Laboratory in Sydney, established to improve efficiency and product standards.

results.title: Our constitution
results.creator_credit: Krishna Gopal, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The spirit of the Indian constitution and the institutions of Indian government. The Federal and State legislatures; how they are elected; how they function; the fields in which they may legislate; the President, Prime Minister, Compotroller and Auditor-General; Union Public Service Commission and Electoral Commission; independence of the judiciary; the citizens’ rights; Indian democracy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Krishna Gopal, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Our changing cities - can they be saved?
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A short history of the development of cities in the United States. Accounts for the social forces and movements which have shaped modern cities, and describes city life of the past and present. Designed for children.

results.title: Our century: invaders
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Mark Hamlyn, Will Davies, Australian Film Commission, Film Australia, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Nine Network
results.brief_description: This episode from ‘Our Century’ and hosted by Ray Martin examines the infestations that have cursed Australia since white settlement. It covers issues such as why some animals and insects were introduced and how we now deal with their devastating effects on the environment.

results.title: Otto Messmer and Felix the Cat
results.brief_description: Presents a tribute to Otto Messmer and his famous cartoon character, Felix the Cat. Features the cartoonist, who describes the evolution of Felix’s personality, and includes excerpts from five vintage shorts starring Felix the Cat. Music by Ross Care. Camera by Richard W. Adams. Written by John Canemaker.

results.title: Ottawa: reflection of a nation
results.brief_description: Canada’s capital city is viewed here in its spring-time splendour. A colorful parade of the Guards on Parliament Hill, the escort of an ambassador in coach-and-four, and away from the pageantry the wildlife refuge of Gatineau Park are featured.
